item.title: DataClasses in Python
item.description: This is one of those cool features you’d probably wished you’d have known about a while back. Unless I’m the only person to not have known this from the start ðŸ™Š DataClasses is a module that was introduced in python 3.7 and described in PEP 557. This module simplifies the creation of new classes by defining boilerplate code for you. Dataclasses are classes designed to store data objects (think case classes in Scala).
